meanings.definition: Make (an action or process) easy or easier.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used visual aids to facilitate learning in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The new software will facilitate faster data processing.
meanings.sent3: To facilitate the meeting, they provided snacks for everyone.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude can facilitate a smooth transition in the team.
meanings.sent5: Music can facilitate relaxation and reduce stress levels.

meanings.sent1: Volunteers work together to facilitate positive changes in the community.
meanings.sent2: The new policy aims to facilitate better communication between departments.
meanings.sent3: To facilitate the surprise party, they had to keep it a secret from the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills can facilitate the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: Teamwork can facilitate achieving common goals effectively.

meanings.sent1: The mentor's guidance will facilitate your career development.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can facilitate weight loss and improve health.
meanings.sent3: To facilitate the road trip, they packed snacks and drinks for the journey.
meanings.sent4: Good time management can facilitate completing tasks on time.
meanings.sent5: Proper planning can facilitate a successful event.
